page.title: 12Communications
page.content: I began my questionaire in Chestnut Way where they considered the postal service to be fair to good. The people did not mind about this but they said that the postal service was not as good as it was 50 years ago. The next morning the telephone service was considered. People thought that it was generally good but some thought that there was some inertia about changes. The nearest telephone kiosks were at the 'Cross' and were thought to be temperemental or probably vandalised. We then considered Television. About half of those questioned liked video recorders, videos and television although Repton seemed more interested in these things than Newton Solney. Cable television was considered to be 'American' and not necessary. Most said there were too many commercials.
